subject: Philosophy
title: Virtue as the Sole Good
description: A quick win: understand Virtue as the Sole Good.

hook.text: Money, health, and fame are preferred. But the Stoics said none of them are truly good.

buildup.text: Only virtue â€” wisdom, courage, justice, temperance â€” qualifies as genuinely good.

discovery.text: A wise person in prison is happier than a foolish person in a palace. Circumstances don't determine character.

twist.text: This sounds extreme. But it frees you from chasing things that can be taken away in an instant.

climax.text: When virtue is your only goal, no external loss can truly harm you.

punchline.text: If you have virtue, you have enough.

quiz.question: What did the Stoics consider the only true good?
